intro: Erodium cicutarium var. arenicola, commonly known as sand eryngo, is a low-growing annual herb native to Mediterranean regions. It features small, yellowish-white flowers and heart-shaped leaves with a distinctive waxy coating. The plant thrives in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in disturbed areas. It has a branched stem and produces numerous small, capsule-like fruits. Sand eryngo is known for its ability to tolerate drought and poor soil conditions.
